events.name: Competitive Programming (CP)
events.about: Competitive Programming is a time-constrained individual contest that tests a participant's ability to devise algorithms, implement them efficiently, and debug under pressure. This event is meant to challenge logical thinking, coding speed, and optimal solution design across topics like data structures, graph theory, dynamic programming, greedy algorithms, and combinatorics.

structure.submissionMethod: Participants submit solutions through the contest platform; multiple submissions allowed

scoring.system: Each solved problem yields points (100-500 points based on difficulty)
scoring.penalty: Wrong submissions incur 10 minute time penalty per submission
scoring.tieBreaker: In case of a tie, ranking is decided by the time of last accepted submission or cumulative time

rules: Registration must be completed before the deadline; team list is locked after that
Participants should report at the venue at least 30 minutes before start
Personal devices such as laptops, smart watches, tablets, or mobile phones are strictly prohibited
Use of external code, plagiarism, or collaboration is not allowed
Tampering with the judging system or scoreboard leads to disqualification
Clarifications will be posted digitally; no verbal interaction with coordinators
Judges' decisions are final and binding
Organizers may pause or extend time in case of technical issues

schedule.activity: Participants check in and get settled
Contest ends and submission window closes

faq.question: Can I use my own laptop?
Which languages can I code in?
faq.answer: C, C++, Java, Python, and JavaScript are supported.

faq.question: Will there be partial scoring?
faq.answer: Yes, if some test batches pass.

faq.question: Can I submit after contest ends?
faq.answer: No. Submission closes at exact end time.

events.name: Prompt to Product
events.about: Innovation and rapid development challenge where teams respond to a prompt by designing, building, and deploying a working prototype within the event timeframe. Encourages creativity, AI integration, architectural planning, and presentation.
deliverables: Live deployed prototype (web app, tool, etc.)
Documentation: architecture, modules, AI usage, team roles
rules: No prior coding of core logic

faq.question: Can we use prewritten modules?
faq.answer: Only minimal utility code; disclose if used.

faq.question: Can we use external APIs or services?
Internet failure?
faq.answer: Organizers may extend time if needed.

events.name: Capture The Flag (CTF)
events.about: Cybersecurity competition where teams solve technical tasks in cryptography, web, reverse engineering, forensics, etc., to capture flags. Safe, controlled, and intellectually challenging.

scoring.system: Tasks have different points (50-500 based on difficulty)

rules: Use of public tools allowed; no direct help

faq.question: Tools like GDB or Burp allowed?

events.name: Treasure Hunt
events.about: Clue-based, campus-wide event where teams decode puzzles, chase hints, and navigate the area to reach the final destination. Focused on teamwork, speed, and reasoning.

faq.question: Lost a clue?
faq.answer: Request a hint with time penalty.

events.name: Treasure Hunt

about.description: The Treasure Hunt is an exciting multi-round team competition that challenges participants‚Äô logical reasoning, problem-solving, and teamwork skills. Teams navigate through progressive rounds, solving clues and overcoming challenges to reach the final treasure.
highlights: Multi-round eliminations leading to the final stage
Focus on teamwork, logic, and observation
Attractive prizes for winners and runners-up

timeline.activity: Ultimate treasure hunt and prize ceremony

rules: Each team must consist of 4 members from the same institution.
Only one team per institution is allowed.
No mobile phones, internet, or external help unless explicitly permitted.
Teams must not damage property or tamper with clues belonging to others.
Teams must stay together throughout the hunt unless instructed otherwise.
Skipping clues or interfering with other teams‚Äô progress results in disqualification.
Organizers‚Äô and judges‚Äô decisions are final and binding.

faqs.question: Can teams use mobile phones for solving clues?
faqs.answer: No. The use of mobile phones or external assistance is strictly prohibited unless stated otherwise.

faqs.question: How many members can a team have?
faqs.answer: Each team must have exactly 4 members from the same institution.

faqs.question: Are there eliminations in each round?
faqs.answer: Yes. Teams will be progressively eliminated after each round.

faqs.question: What are the prizes?
faqs.answer: Winners and runners-up will receive certificates and prizes.

faqs.question: Is safety ensured during the hunt?
faqs.answer: Yes. Participants must act responsibly; organizers are not liable for injuries due to negligence.

events.name: Chess Tournament
events.about: A strategic, FIDE-rule chess competition using either Swiss or knockout system based on participation.

structure.pairing: Random pairing for Round 1, then skill-based

faq.question: Draws allowed?
faq.answer: Yes, per FIDE or tie-break rules.

events.name: BGMI Tournament
events.about: Mobile e-sports tournament on Erangel map. Team battle royale format with tactical, reflexive gameplay.

contact.name: Vikram Singh
contact.venue: Gaming Arena - Block D, Ground Floor

events.name: FIFA Tournament (EA FC 24)
events.about: 1v1 knockout digital football competition using standard club teams.

contact.name: Rohan Mehta
contact.venue: Gaming Arena - Block D, Ground Floor

events.name: Valorant Tournament
events.about: 5v5 tactical shooter tournament using standard competitive format and maps.

faq.question: Can all 5 play remotely?
faq.answer: No. At least 3 must be present.

faq.question: Streaming allowed?
faq.answer: Only after match and with permission.

events.name: Ideathon

about.description: The Startup Pitch Competition challenges participants to think like entrepreneurs and present their innovative product ideas to a panel of judges. Teams will create a 10-slide investor pitch deck and deliver a 3-minute live pitch focusing on Go-to-Market strategy, Financials, Innovation, and Impact. This event provides a real-world startup experience and helps participants sharpen their pitching, planning, and presentation skills.
highlights: Focus on innovation, financial viability, and impact
Attractive awards for best pitch, product plan, and prototype

timeline.activity: Preparation of the 10-slide investor pitch deck
Evaluation based on Go-to-Market, Financials, Innovation, Impact, and Q&A handling

rules: Each team must consist of 3‚Äì5 members with diverse roles (technical, business, design, presentation).
All ideas must be original and should aim to solve a real-world problem.
Pitch decks should not exceed 10 slides.
The live pitch should strictly be within 3 minutes.
Any plagiarism or use of pre-existing startup ideas will lead to disqualification.
Judges' decisions are final and binding.

faqs.question: Can we choose any product idea?
faqs.answer: Yes. Teams are free to select any idea that is innovative, viable, and solves a real problem.

faqs.question: Do we need a working prototype?
faqs.answer: A working prototype is not mandatory but is encouraged to strengthen your pitch.

faqs.question: How many members can be in a team?
faqs.answer: Teams can have a minimum of 3 and a maximum of 5 members.

faqs.question: How long should the pitch presentation be?
faqs.answer: Each team gets exactly 3 minutes for their live pitch.

faqs.question: What are the award categories?
faqs.answer: Best Product Plan, Best Prototype Execution, and Best Pitch Delivery.
